hedline.hl1: NORTEL WINS CHINA AND TAIWAN DEALS

abstract.p: Nortel Networks of Canada wins two contracts worth $525 million to build wireless telephone systems in China and Taiwan; one contract, worth $250 million, is for 1,900 new base stations for cellular telephone and Internet transmission for Chunghwa Telecom in Taiwan; second $275 million, contract is with Zhejiang Unicom in China to install infrastructure and software for wireless Internet services (S)

block.p: Nortel Networks of Canada has won two contracts worth $525 million to build wireless telephone systems in China and Taiwan. One contract, worth $250 million, is for 1,900 new base stations for cellular phone and Internet transmission for Chunghwa Telecom in Taiwan. Chunghwa has given Nortel, which is based in Brampton, Ontario, $900 million worth of orders since 1994. The second, $275 million, contract is with Zhejiang Unicom in China to install infrastructure and software for wireless Internet services.
